Ann

messages.msgSnippet: ... Wow, Ann.  This is so neat!. Someone posted a question about peacocks on another homeschooling list I m on just yesterday.  Their kids had been playing a
messages.messageBody:
A.Y. wrote:

> From: "A.Y." <hooperck@...>
>
> We have to share with you that this AM our first ever peacock egg
> hatched. So exciting.

Wow, Ann. This is so neat!. Someone posted a question about peacocks on
another homeschooling list I'm on just yesterday. Their kids had been
playing a trivia game where the answer to one of the questions was that
peacocks don't lay eggs. She wanted to know if this was true. (Of course
it is -- peacocks don't lay eggs, but peahens certainly do :-).

Several people came back with all kinds of information about peafowl having
searched it out on the internet. Some people are really getting into the
whole peafowl thing. Can I share your message about incubating the eggs
with the other list?

Sandy <skeane@...> http://mypage.direct.ca/s/skeane/
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Summer Haiku

Smell of glove leather,
grassy stains and diamond dust,
green cathedrals......life. -sk
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
